melancholy.used_in_sentence: My massive homework amount makes me melancholy.

abhor.definition: to hate very much; to detest utterly

defunct.definition: no longer effective or useful; having ceased to exist

refute.definition: to show to be false; to deny the truth of
refute.used_in_sentence: I refute the claims that I don't have a functioning brain.

exacerbate.used_in_sentence: I will not exacerbate the unusablness of my brain.

chagrin.used_in_sentence: Ben was filled with chagrin when he broke the typewriter.

petulant.used_in_sentence: Anthony is very petulant in math class.

sublime.used_in_sentence: The sublime elegance of a penguin in a tutu gracefully ice-skating under a shower of popcorn had the audience questioning their popcorn-induced hallucinations.

tribulation.used_in_sentence: Anthony faces tribulation not to talk all math class.

fret.definition: to cause or to suffer emotional stress
fret.used_in_sentence: The squirrel fretted about its acorn collection, unaware that a jazz band of chipmunks was using them as maracas for their forest concert.

deter.definition: to discourage or prevent from acting
deter.used_in_sentence: My idiocy deters me from getting an A+.

winnow.used_in_sentence: You can not winnow my brain from my head because I don't have one.

circumvent.definition: to manage to get around, especially by ingenuity

meticulous.definition: marked by extreme care in the consideration of details
meticulous.used_in_sentence: My homework is not very meticulous.

digression.definition: the act of leaving the main subject in writing or a speech
digression.used_in_sentence: This is a digression from my homework.

pertain.definition: to be appropriate to something; to belong as a part of something
pertain.used_in_sentence: This sentence does not pertain to the word.

miscreant.definition: one who behaves criminally or viciously

resilient.definition: tending to recover from misfortune or change
resilient.used_in_sentence: My unintelligent brain is not resilient.

taciturn.used_in_sentence: Anthony is not taciturned in math class.

fluctuate.definition: to change continuously; to rise and fall
fluctuate.used_in_sentence: My intelligence does not flucate as it is at the bottom.

persevere.used_in_sentence: As the frugal squirrel tried to persevere through winter, he decided to eschew luxury nuts and obfuscate his hiding spots with clever acorn decoys.

eschew.used_in_sentence: The frugal wizard, known for his ability to persevere through any magical mess, would often eschew expensive spells and obfuscate his potions with budget-friendly ingredients.

frugal.used_in_sentence: Persevering through a maze of tangled spaghetti, the frugal chef decided to eschew fancy sauces and obfuscate his recipe with a mysterious sprinkle of parmesan.

obfuscate.used_in_sentence: In an attempt to persevere during the annual rubber duck race, the frugal contestant opted to eschew flashy decorations and obfuscate his duck with a stealthy camouflage paint job.

propensity.definition: an intense natural inclination or preference
propensity.used_in_sentence: With an unexpected propensity for juggling flamingos, Gerald often found himself the star of the local zoo's annual talent show.

venerate.used_in_sentence: The ancient tribe would venerate a giant rubber chicken as their sacred totem, believing it to bring bouncy blessings upon their crops.

feisty.used_in_sentence: The feisty kitten, armed with a tiny pirate hat, boldly declared her intentions to conquer the living room couch and claim it as her pirate ship..

excursion.used_in_sentence: The feisty kitten, armed with a tiny pirate hat, boldly declared her intentions to conquer the living room couch and claim it as her pirate ship.

fulgent.used_in_sentence: The fulgent disco ball, spinning wildly above the dance floor, cast a dazzling array of colors across the feisty kitten's tiny pirate hat.

rejuvenate.definition: give new energy or vigor to
rejuvenate.used_in_sentence: The feisty kitten, exhausted from her daring couch conquest, decided to rejuvenate her spirits by taking a quick nap in the sunbeam.

beleaguer.definition: to cause problems or difficulties for
beleaguer.used_in_sentence: The feisty kitten, armed with a tiny pirate hat, boldly declared her intentions to conquer the living room couch and claim it as her pirate ship.

locquacious.definition: tending to talk a great deal
